alert.note: Alert for Aurora; Brule (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued January 31 at 2:55AM MST until January 31 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT LATE THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON FOR PORTIONS OF SOUTH CENTRAL AND SOUTHEAST SOUTH DAKOTA... .Unseasonably warm weather combines with increasing southwest winds gusting up to 35 mph this afternoon. Relative humidity values will drop below 25 percent for portions of south central and southeast South Dakota. This combination of low humidity and gusty winds would support critical fire weather conditions. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 PM CST THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 057 and 058... The National Weather Service in Sioux Falls has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 11 AM this morning to 6 PM CST this evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire weather zones 057 and 058. * WIND...Southwest winds will increase by mid-day Monday and become strong in the afternoon. Sustained winds 20 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph will be possible. * HUMIDITY...Lowest relative humidity values may fall between 15 and 25 percent by the middle of the afternoon. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
